data.name: Mongol Invasion
data.description:
## Mongol Invasion
### By InsertIGN

#### The Mongol Horde is incoming
Your goal is to defend your homeland and prevent its destruction at the hands of the Mongols. If they manage to get any further than they already have, your country will be wiped off the face of the Earth. The only solution to this issue is to destroy them. Permanantly. The Mongol's state-of-the-art battle technique consists of never using the same type of soldier in battle more than once. To destroy their army, you must simply remove all soldiers that are not your own from a list of the people on the battlefield.

#### In a simple-man's terms, filter out all characters that are NOT duplicates out of a list.

### Good Luck!

Notes: All inputs will always be valid, i.e. there will only be one duplicated character. You will be provided a List of Characters, and you have to return that List without duplicates.

#### Examples
```java
MongolDefense.defend(Arrays.asList('a', 'a', '@', 'c', 'b', 'z', '$', 'k', 'a', 'a', 'j', '%')) => Arrays.asList('a', 'a', 'a', 'a') // filtering out all duplicates
```
```java
MongolDefense.defend(Arrays.asList('@', '@', '9', 'c', '2', '5', '$', 'g', '@', '#', '@', '*')) => Arrays.asList('@', '@', '@', '@') // filtering out all duplicates
```
```java
MongolDefense.defend(Arrays.asList('9', 'm', 'g', 'd', '6', '%', '6', '$', '@', '8', '6', 's')) => Arrays.asList('6', '6', '6') // filtering out all duplicates
```
